text: John Chandler Holloway (July 7, 1826 – February 26, 1901) was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly and the Wisconsin State Senate. ==Biography== Holloway was born on July 7, 1826 in York, New York. Later, he moved to Lancaster, Wisconsin. Chandler died in Cloverdale, California on February 26, 1901. ==Career== Holloway was a member of the Assembly during the 1871 session and of the Senate from the 16th District during the 1872, 1873, 1874 and 1875 session. In 1874, he was chosen to be President Pro Tem. Previously, Holloway was Chairman of the Town Board of Lancaster from 1857 to 1861. He was a Republican. ==References== ==External links== * Category:People from York, New York Category:People from Lancaster, Wisconsin Category:Mayors of places in Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:1826 births Category:1901 deaths
title: John Chandler Holloway
